column4: i pull up my computer and it shows acer(C:\) data(D:\) both are 69.5gigs does that mean the hard drive is partioned?
use disk manager to check
where do i get that at?
rightclick my computer -> manage
the D:\ says healthy(primary partion)
sure but is it on the same disk?
the guys in ##windows will have a better idea and is where your OS is supported
you can boot to livecd and install it. If you are using ubuntu right now then it is installed
i want to remove grub2 and ubuntu so i can use the recovery partion acer set up on this laptop to resore windows
if you delete the ubuntu partitions it should make the recovery partition work
so download gparted.iso and burn it to a cd boot from that and remove ubuntu?
why bother, the ubuntu livecd has gparted on it...
if i have ubuntu 11.04 installed and make a partion to install windows will grub automatically show up?
no you will need to reinstate it as windows willblindly overwrite the MBR
will that erase ubuntu?
no
it does, the installed OS will be the same
did you install the guest additions?
i know that but its not the same graphic/ UI look
i have no clue if i did all i did was create it using the iso
get updated, see if it helps
the guest additions are installable in the menus in the virtualbox window: http://www.dedoimedo.com/images/computers/2008/virtualbox-install-guest-additions.jpg
